Question 174) Ceramics is a very present artifact in the history of humanity. One of its various properties is retraction (contraction), which consists of evaporation of water in a set or ceramic block when subjected to a certain high temperature. This temperature rise, which occurs during the cooking process, causes a reduction of up to 20% in the linear dimensions of a part.
Suppose a piece, when shaped in clay, had a rectangular base whose sides media 30 cm and 15 cm. After cooking, these sides were reduced by 20%.
Compared to the original area, the base area of ​​this piece, after cooking, was reduced in
A) 4%.
B) 20%.
C) 36%.
D) 64%.
E) 96%.
